docs.title: Welcome to Islamic Resources
docs.text:
Islamic Resources is your hub for accessing a curated collection of Islamic materials aimed at helping both learners and teachers. Our platform features Arabic transliterations to assist English speakers in mastering the proper pronunciation of Arabic terms.

Our website is organized into several sections:

  • Qur'ān: Resources to aid with accurate recitation of the Holy Qur'ān
  • Ḥadīth: Authentic traditions and sayings
  • Dhikr: The best phrases of remembrance from the Prophet ﷺ
  • Duʿās: Essential supplications and prayers

We invite you to explore these resources and enhance your understanding and practice of Islam.

docs.title: Dhikr
docs.text: This section offers a collection of Dhikr resources, including supplications and recitations, along with guidance for daily remembrance.

docs.title: Duʿā for Anxiety
docs.text:
Allāhumma innī ʿabduka, ibnu ʿabdika, ibnu 'amatika, nāṣiyatī biyadika, māḍin fiyya ḥukmuka, ʿadlun fiyya qaḍā'uka, as'aluka bi-kullismin huwa laka, sammayta bihī nafsaka, aw anzaltahu fī kitābika, aw ʿallamtahu aḥadam-min khalqika, awista'tharta bihī fī ʿilmil-ghaybi ʿindaka, an tajʿalal-qur'āna rabīʿa qalbi, wa nūra ṣadrī, wa jalā'a huznī, wa dhahāba hammī

"اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي عَبْدُكَ، ابْنُ عَبْدِكَ، ابْنُ أَمَتِكَ، نَاصِيَتِي بِيَدِكَ، مَاضٍ فِيَّ حُكْمُكَ، عَدْلٌ فِيَّ قَضَاؤُكَ، أَسْأَلُكَ بِكُلِّ اسْمٍ هُوَ لَكَ سَمَّيْتَ بِهِ نَفْسَكَ، أَوْ أَنْزَلْتَهُ فِي كِتَابِكَ، أَوْ عَلَّمْتَهُ أَحَدًا مِنْ خَلْقِكَ، أَوِ اسْتَأْثَرْتَ بِهِ فِي عِلْمِ الْغَيْبِ عِنْدَكَ، أَنْ تَجْعَلَ الْقُرْآنَ رَبِيعَ قَلْبِي، وَنُورَ صَدْرِي، وَجَلَاءَ حُزْنِي، وَذَهَابَ هَمِّي"

O Allah, I am Your slave, and the son of Your male slave, and the son of your female slave. My forehead is in Your Hand (i.e. you have control over me). Your Judgment upon me is assured, and Your Decree concerning me is just. I ask You by every Name that You have named Yourself with, revealed in Your Book, taught any one of Your creation, or kept unto Yourself in the knowledge of the unseen that is with You, to make the Qur'an the spring of my heart, and the light of my chest, the banisher of my sadness, and the reliever of my distress.

docs.title: Duʿās
docs.text: This section offers a collection of Duʿās (supplications) for various occasions. Browse through these prayers to find guidance, comfort, and inspiration for your daily journey in faith.

docs.title: Duʿā for Righteous Children
docs.text:
Rabbī hab lī min ladunka dhurriyyatan ṭayyibatan innaka samīʿu d-duʿāʾ

"رَبِّ هَبْ لِي مِن لَّدُنكَ ذُرِّيَّةً طَيِّبَةً ۖ إِنَّكَ سَمِيعُ الدُّعَاءِ"

My Lord, grant me from Yourself righteous offspring. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication.

Rabbanā hab lanā min azwājinā wa dhurriyyātinā qurrata aʿyunin wa-jʿalnā lil-muttaqīna imāmā

"رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّاتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَاجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا"

Our Lord, grant us from among our spouses and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous.

Rabbi-j'alnī muqīma ṣ-ṣalāti wa-min dhurriyyatī rabbanā wa-taqabbal duʿāʾ

"رَبِّ اجْعَلْنِي مُقِيمَ الصَّلَاةِ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِي ۚ رَبَّنَا وَتَقَبَّلْ دُعَاءِ"

My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.

docs.title: Context and Virtues
docs.text:
These beautiful supplications are from the Quran and were made by prophets:

  1. The first dua was made by Prophet Zakariya (peace be upon him) as mentioned in Surah Al-Imran (3:38).

  2. The second dua is taught to us in Surah Al-Furqan (25:74) as a quality of the servants of the Most Merciful.

  3. The third dua was made by Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) as mentioned in Surah Ibrahim (14:40).

Making dua for righteous children is a sunnah of the prophets. Having children who are righteous, obedient to Allah, and beneficial to society is one of the greatest blessings a parent can have. The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ said: "When a person dies, his deeds come to an end except for three: ongoing charity, beneficial knowledge, or a righteous child who prays for him."

It is recommended to make these duas regularly, especially during times when prayers are more likely to be accepted, such as during the last third of the night, while prostrating, and between the adhan and iqamah.

docs.title: Sayyid al-Istighfār Duʿā
docs.text: "Allahumma anta rabbi, la ilaha illa anta, khalaqtani wa ana 'abduka, wa ana 'ala 'ahdika wa wa'dika mastata't, a'udhu bika min sharri ma sana't. Abu dhun bi dhanbi, wa abu dhun bidhanbi, wa abu dhun bidhanbi. Faghfir li dhanbi, innahu la yaghfiru adh-dhunuba illa anta."

docs.title: Fiqh
docs.text: This section provides an introduction to Fiqh, covering the principles and practices of Islamic jurisprudence. Explore various topics, including worship, transactions, and personal conduct, to gain a deeper understanding of Islamic law and its application in daily life.
